Title: Software Engineering Co-Op - Kettering
Job_Description:
Why engineering at Stryker?
At Stryker we are dedicated to improving lives, with a passion for researching and developing new medical device products. As an engineer at Stryker, you will be proud of the work that you will be doing, using cutting-edge technologies to make healthcare better. Here, you will work in a supportive culture with other incredibly talented and intelligent people, creating industry-leading medical technology products. You will also have growth opportunities as we have a culture that supports your personal and professional development.

Title: IT Project Manager- Northeast
Job_Description:
Why join Stryker?
We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine! Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com
Our benefits include bonuses; commissions; healthcare; insurance benefits; retirement programs; stock based plans; paid time off plans; family and parenting leaves; tuition reimbursement; wellness programs; onsite fitness centers and cafeterias; discount purchase programs; and service and performance awards – not to mention various social and recreational activities.

Based remotely in the Northeast, you will plan and coordinate all aspects of internal information system-specific projects from initiation to delivery. Projects often involve network, server, or software implementation and upgrades, PC deployment and the like. Coordinates work performed by IT staff and internal customers/partners by defining project requirements, performing feasibility and needs/impact assessments. Develops detailed project plans and manages all implementation processes including resource allocation, progress tracking, monitoring change control process, testing, documentation, training and on-time delivery within budget constraints

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Job_Description:
Serve as an SME for analyzing the business data and provide thought leadership on all matters related to BI and Data Warehouse
Be the point person for analytics in the organization. You will work with people on the business and technical side to design, develop, deploy, and support analytics on the BI platform
Understand business requirements regarding key business metrics and KPIs, and provide development of dashboards, visualizations, goals, and ad-hoc reports.
Use analytical insights to help increase business teams effectiveness against key strategic goals
Work with business, and technical stakeholders to define requirements for new projects and enhancements to existing solutions
Support the modernization of our analytical capabilities and growing our data-driven culture by staying up to date on new features, demoing capabilities, developing POC’s and related activities

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Description:

Summary:
Yorktown systems Group is seeking a highly qualified TCM SBCT Information Technology and Security Analyst to provide professional services to execute, operate and maintain, and assist in the integration of Doctrine, Organization, Training, Materiel, Leadership, Personnel and Facilities (DOTMLPF) improvements into SBCT formations in support of the U.S. Army TRADOC Capability Manager for Stryker Brigade Combat Team (TCM SBCT). TCM SBCT is TRADOC’s DOTMLPF integrator for SBCT formations. This mission requires intensive interaction with these units, operating force Major Commands, acquisition communities and TRADOC Centers of Excellence. TCM SBT requires support in six key areas of its mission: 1) Material Integration and
Program Management; 2) Stryker Requirements and Test & Evaluation; 3) Stryker Training Aids, Devices,

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Job_Description:
JOB OVERVIEW:
Exercise Analyst supporting Mission Command Training Program (MCTP) War Fighter Exercises at the Division level.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:
Responsible for coordinating with the Army on Movement and Maneuver/ Command and Control Warfighting Function issues. As such interfaces with the Army customer for analysis of the battlefield events.
Directly monitors all operational aspect of the WARSIM simulation to include potential relationship with the other WfF, analyzes key battlefield events from the combined arms maneuver perspective and prepares multi-media products to be used in the After Action Review process.
Position Requirements

Title: Field Service Representative
Job_Description:
MSG is seeking an experienced and detailed oriented Field Service Representative that is an enthusiastic self-starter. The ideal candidate must have proven skills in deliver the highest level of customer service experience. Reporting to the prime's lead FSR, you will be working with a highly energetic team focused on fast-paced product development and unsurpassed quality. Typical Defense Products may include items such as vehicle upfit kits, mobility enhancement components, weapon system components and integration kits, radar/surveillance systems, security systems, defense platforms, and advanced military vehicles. Effective collaboration and communications with customers, suppliers, engineering, purchasing, quality, manufacturing, and sales is critical to being successful in this position.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Supports the installation, maintenance, operation, troubleshooting, repair, and customer training of products at customer locations, military bases, and training/test sites

Title: Field Service Representative
Job_Description:
Leonardo DRS is a prime contractor, leading technology innovator and supplier of integrated products, services and support to military forces, intelligence agencies and defense contractors worldwide. The company specializes in naval and maritime systems, ground combat mission command and network computing, global satellite communications and network infrastructure, avionics systems, and intelligence and security solutions. Additionally, the company builds power systems and electro-optical/infrared systems for a wide range of commercial customers. Headquartered in Arlington, Virginia, Leonardo DRS is a wholly owned subsidiary of Leonardo S.p.A. For additional information on DRS, please visit our website at www.leonardodrs.com

Job ID: 104599

The Leonardo DRS Land Electronics business provides C4I Network computing and integrated situational awareness, as well as state-of-the-art embedded diagnostics, vehicle power management and combat vehicle integration products and services.

Job Summary
Support Leonardo DRS Technology and Equipment in operating environments at depots, training sites, and customer field operations with training, operation, and repair. Job Responsibilities
Basic Qualifications
Only candidates that meet the qualifications set forth above are eligible to be contacted for further information. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas.
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families, and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, Leonardo DRS is taking action to address the risk and uncertainty COVID variants pose in the workplace. We require all newly hired employees in the United States to be fully vaccinated, unless a medical or religious accommodation is formally approved by Leonardo DRS prior to commencing employment.
Leonardo DRS, Inc. and its subsidiaries and affiliates are equal opportunity employers and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. #LEL

Title: Field Service Representative
Job_Description:
The Company
Noah Medical is building the future of medical robotics. Our next generation robotic platform targets early diagnosis and treatment of patients across multiple disease states. Based in Silicon Valley and backed by well-known institutional investors, our incredibly talented team of 150+ engineers, innovators and industry leaders brings years of experience from the top healthcare companies in the world, including: Intuitive, Auris, Stryker, Johnson & Johnson, Boston Scientific, Verb Surgical, Mako, Think Surgical, Medrobotics & Hansen.
Noah Medical is looking for a full time Senior DevOps Engineer.
Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain infrastructure services to support software team productivity.

Title: Senior Manager, Test R&D
Job_Description:
The last 12 months have been amazing for esports at Riot. We held our most-watched League of Legends Worlds Championship ever, and we ran our first global tournaments for VALORANT, Wild Rift, and Legends of Runeterra. On the back of that success, and in our ever-growing dedication to our mission to be the most player focused company in the world, Riot is doubling down on our investment in the esports and fan experience with industry-leading innovations like Project Stryker that will make our ambitions come to life.
That's where you come in.
The Global Technology Group's mission is to ensure efficient production of Esports content, globally. As an Engineering Manager you'll support a team focused on building the infrastructure, tooling and applications that power Riot's Esports endeavors around the globe. You will encourage innovation, set and provide value to our internal customers.

Company_Name: ['WMU Homer Stryker, M.D. School of Medicine', '3.7']
Title: Student Affairs Data Analyst
Job_Description:
Overview: Western Michigan University Homer Stryker M.D. School of Medicine is seeking a Data Analyst I. Collaborates to administer the Student Information Systems. Provides moderate data analysis, data mining, reporting, and visualization tools. Manages configuration, deployment, upgrades, permission levels and troubleshooting of the student information system and the interfaces with other applications. Assists with additional duties as listed below.
The Student Affairs Analyst I contributes to oversight of process workflow including staff workload and responsibilities, assures meeting deadlines of all student affairs needs, and implements continuing process improvement to achieve performance excellence.
Responsible for the administration of: student information system; maintenance and access to student information content including student life, financial aid, student records/registrar, accounting, and admissions. Participates in records assessment, accreditation, and quality improvement.
Responsibilities:
